cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 75 (Wednesday, May 1, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. LEE of Pennsylvania:H.R. 8210.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Art. I, Sec. 8The single subject of this legislation is:To amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act toeliminate a requirement that certain individuals be relatedby blood or marriage to be eligible for farm loans as aqualified beginning farmer or rancher, and for other purposes[Page H2830]

bill.title: Future Farmers and Ranchers of Tomorrow Act of 2024

item.title: Future Farmers and Ranchers of Tomorrow Act of 2024
Future Farmers and Ranchers of Tomorrow Act of 2024

To amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to eliminate a requirement that certain individuals be related by blood or marriage to be eligible for farm loans as a qualified beginning farmer or rancher, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on General Farm Commodities, Risk Management, and Credit.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
